revisions.rev:
{{Infobox person | name = Carel Struycken | image = Carel Struycken.jpg | caption = Carel Struycken in 2009. | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1948|7|30}} | birth_place = [[The Hague]], [[Netherlands]] | death_date = | death_place = |height={{height|ft=7|in=0}} | other_names = | website = {{URL|carelstruycken.com}} | academyawards = | spouse = | occupation = Actor }} '''Carel Struycken''' (born July 30, 1948) is a Dutch film, television, and stage actor. He is best known for playing [[Mr. Homn]] on the television series ''[[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]'' and [[Lurch (The Addams Family)|Lurch]] in the films ''[[The Addams Family (film)|The Addams Family]]'' and ''[[Addams Family Values]]''. He is an exceptionally tall man at 2.13 metres (7 feet) and thus is often called upon to play character or [[comedy|comedic]] roles in which height plays a major part.
==Biography== Struycken was born in [[The Hague]], [[Netherlands]]. When he was 4 years old his family moved to [[CuraÃ§ao]], an island in the Caribbean. At age 15, while living on the island of CuraÃ§ao, he composed several Caribbean [[waltz]]es. At 16 he returned to his home country, where he finished secondary school. He graduated from the directing program at the film school in [[Amsterdam]]. Following that, he spent a year at the [[American Film Institute]] in [[Los Angeles]]. In 1978 he was "discovered" as an actor.
Struycken is considered a [[Gigantism|giant]] as the result of [[acromegaly]].
== Personal life == Struycken is married to an American woman and has two children. He lives in the [[Los Angeles]] area. His brother Peter Struycken is a noted Dutch artist.
Struycken is a [[Vegetarianism|vegetarian]] on ethical grounds.
== Career == Struycken collaborated on a number of projects with writer/director [[Rene Daalder]], including the 1986 punk rock musical ''[[Population: 1]]'', which featured [[Tomata du Plenty]] of [[The Screamers]] and which was released on DVD in October 2008.<ref>http://www.population1movie.com/</ref> Struycken was "discovered" as an actor at the corner of [[Hollywood and Vine]] in Los Angeles by a lady who had abandoned her car in the middle of the street, calling after him: "We need you for a movie!".<ref>Carel Struycken tells the anecdote about his discovery as an actor in an interview on the daily Dutch TV show ''[http://dewerelddraaitdoor.vara.nl/terugkijken.php?id=175 De Wereld Draait Door]'', October 2, 2006 (at 41:08 min.)</ref> The movie was ''[[Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band (film)|Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band]]''.
The turning point in his acting career however was playing the antagonist Terak in ''[[Ewoks: The Battle for Endor]]'', based on the [[Ewok]] creatures from ''[[Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the Jedi]]''. Notably Struycken was featured as [[Mr. Homn]] on the television series ''[[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]''. He also co-starred as Fidel in the 1987 film ''[[The Witches of Eastwick (film)|The Witches of Eastwick]]'' and as [[Lurch (The Addams Family)|Lurch]] in the The Addams Family films (see Filmography).
For his other exploits see the Filmography and Television series.
== Today == Struycken is interested in making projects that are a combination of media, like using the non-linear character of Internet with video and graphical elements. These are usually low budget productions. Struycken is also a keen and active photographer. A combination of these techniques can be seen [http://www.sphericalpanoramas.com/ here] and [http://www.picturebubbles.com/blog/ here (in collaboration with Josh Korwin)]. Struycken has also helped in hardware and software development of [[virtual reality]] systems.<ref> [http://www.vrmag.org/vartist/spotlight/AN_INTERVIEW_WITH_CAREL_STRUYCKEN_AND_THE_GRONINGER_MUSEUM_EXHIBIT.html Interview in Virtual Reality Magazine]</ref>

==Television series== *''[[St. Elsewhere]]'' (1988), Season 6 episode "Fairytale Theater", as "The Giant" *''[[Twin Peaks]]'' (1990â1991), as "[[The Giant (Twin Peaks)|The Giant]]" *''[[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]'' (1987â1992), as "[[List of minor recurring characters in Star Trek: The Next Generation#Mr._Homn|Mr. Homn]]" *''[[Babylon 5]]'' (1994), Season 2 episode "[[Soul Mates]]", as "Trader" *''[[Star Trek: Voyager]]'' (1996), Season 2 episode "The Thaw", as "Spectre" *''[[Charmed]]'' (2002), Season 4 episode "Womb Raider", as "Tall Man" *''[[My Name Is Earl]]'' (2006), Season 2 episode "Sticks & Stones", as "Paul" *''[[Cold Case (TV series)|Cold Case]]'' (2010), Season 7 episode 14 "Metamorphisis", as "Gargantuan"
